Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by Reverend Susan Karlson, Minister, The Unitarian Church of Staten Island, 312 Fillmore Street, Staten Island, NY 10301.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Rose.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Reverend Susan Karlson, Minister, The Unitarian Church of Staten Island, 312 Fillmore Street, Staten Island, NY 10301.

Council Member Rose moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of June 14, 2011 be adopted as printed by Council Member Dromm.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Dromm moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of June 14, 2011 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices

Vincent Calamia, M.D., Council candidate for designation and subsequent appointment by the Mayor to the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation Board of Directors to serve for the remainder of a five-year term that will expire on March 20, 2016.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Comrie
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Applications no. C 110059 ZSK, C 110060 (A) ZSK, C 110061 ZSK and C 110062 (A) ZSK, special permits, shall be subject to Council review.  This application is related to application no. C 110058 ZMK that is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Speical Permits (C110059ZSK, C110060(A)ZSK, C110061ZSK and C110062(A) ZSK)

Items.Title:
By The Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 70 7th Avenue South, Council District no. 4 Application no. 20115769 TCM, shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk café, 70 Seventh Ave, Manhattan (20115769 TCM)

Items.Title:
By The Speaker (Council Member Quinn):

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutions
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the Human Resources Administration and the Department of Youth and Community Development to publish on the agencies’ websites information relating to the process for youth and young adults aged sixteen through twenty applying for or receiving public assistance.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: HRA and the Dept of Youth & Community Development to publish on the agencies’ websites information relating to the process for youth & young adults aged 16 through 20 applying for or receiving public assistance.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting requirements for the department of citywide administrative services on the status of city-owned real property.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Reporting requirements for DCAS on the status of city-owned real property.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States House of Representatives and the United States Senate to pass and the President to sign H.R. 1390 entitled “The Bus Uniform Standards and Enhanced Safety Act of 2011,” which would seek to strengthen the regulation, monitoring and oversight of the motor carrier industry.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: The Bus Uniform Standards and Enhanced Safety Act of 2011 (H.R. 1390)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress and the President of the United States to increase funding for research on stroke prevention and treatment.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Increase funding for research on stroke prevention and treatment.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon New York State to amend the Social Services Law in order to allow a parent or other relative of a child up to age one exemption from participation in welfare to work activities.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Amend the Social Services Law in order to allow a parent or other relative of a child up to age one exemption from participation in welfare to work activities.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the Human Resources Administration to clarify the process for serving youth and young adults aged 16 through twenty-four receiving public assistance as head of household.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Requiring HRA to clarify the process for serving youth & young adults aged 16 through 24 receiving public assistance as head of household.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Bloomberg Administration to discontinue the use and development of Worker Connect, a shared database that gives workers across health and human services agencies access to personal client information.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Bloomberg Administration to discontinue the use and development of Worker Connect.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to permitting the appeal of decisions by the board of standards and appeals to the city council.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Permitting the appeal of decisions by the board of standards and appeals to the city council.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to expiration of variances granted by the board of standards and appeals.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Expiration of variances granted by the board of standards and appeals.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring signs at shared bicycle and pedestrian paths.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring signs at shared bicycle and pedestrian paths.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the registration of owners of vacant property.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring the registration of owners of vacant property.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Information Technology and Telecommunications to work with the New York City Police and Fire Departments as well as wireless carriers to develop a plan that would allow New York City residents to contact 911 and 311 through text messages.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Develop a plan that would allow New York City residents to contact 911 and 311 through text messages.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating an interagency task force on electric assisted bicycle safety.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Creating an interagency task force on electric assisted bicycle safety.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to animal shelters in the city of New York, to repeal section 17-801 in relation thereto, and to repeal and re-enact section 17-809.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Animal shelters in NYC, to repeal section 17-801 in relation thereto, and to repeal and re-enact section 17-809.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to persons not to be detained.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Persons not to be detained.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting the Governor’s proposal to amend the Penal Law to make possession of a small quantity of marihuana in public view a violation, applauding the Speaker of the Assembly for his support of the proposal, and calling upon the New York Senate to pass legislation enacting the same.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Make possession of a small quantity of marihuana in public view a violation.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to collecting and reporting data related to access of individuals aged sixteen through twenty-four to public assistance as head of household.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Collecting and reporting data related to access of individuals aged 16 through 24 to public assistance as head of household.

Items.Title: Resolution approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting requirements for housing subsidies provided by the city of New York.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Reporting requirements for housing subsidies provided by the city of New York.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the waiver of public employee organizations’ rights when submitting grievances to arbitration under the New York city collective bargaining law.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Waiver of public employee organizations’ rights when submitting grievances to arbitration under the NYC collective bargaining law.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing notice regarding permits for movie-making, telecasting and photography in public places.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Providing notice regarding permits for movie-making, telecasting and photography in public places.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the Department of Homeless Services to report on a monthly basis the location of all of their facilities.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Requiring the Department of Homeless Services to report on a monthly basis the location of all of their facilities.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Federal Reserve Bank to rescind its proposed rule requiring borrowers to pay off the remaining principal on a mortgage before the lender is forced to cancel its security interest in the home.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Community Development
Items.MatterName: Federal Reserve Bank to rescind its proposed rule requiring borrowers to pay off the remaining principal on a mortgage before the lender is forced to cancel its security interest in the home.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature and the Governor to enact legislation that would prohibit lenders from concealing mortgage assignments through the use of the Mortgage Electronic Registration System, Inc., known as MERS.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Community Development
Items.MatterName: Prohibit lenders from concealing mortgage assignments through the use of the Mortgage Electronic Registration System, Inc., known as MERS.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature and the Governor to enact legislation that would require the foreclosing party in a mortgage foreclosure action to produce the pooling and service agreement at the commencement of a mortgage foreclosure action.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Community Development
Items.MatterName: Require the foreclosing party in a mortgage foreclosure action to produce the pooling and service agreement at the commencement of a mortgage foreclosure action.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the fines for commercial vehicles that park on residential streets.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Increasing the fines for commercial vehicles that park on residential streets

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing violations to be issued based on vehicle identification numbers.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Allowing violations to be issued based on vehicle identification numbers.
